title: Thomas Bernhard - 5 Novels
description:
THOMAS BERNHARD (1931-1989) was an Austrian novelist, playwright and poet.  He originally studied music in Salzburg but in 1957 began a second career writing plays, poems, and novels. The winner of the three most distinguished and coveted literary prizes awarded in Germany, he became one of the most widely translated and admired writers of his generation.


The following novels are in EPUB format:

* CONCRETE (Quartet, 1989).  Translated by David McLintock with an Introduction by Martin Chalmers.

* CORRECTION (Alfred A. Knopf, 1979).  Translated by Sophie Wilkins.

* FROST (Alfred A. Knopf, 2006).  Translated by Michael Hofmann.

* GARGOYLES (Alfred A. Knopf, 1970).  Translated by Richard and Clara Winston.

* THE LOSER (Alfred A. Knopf, 1991).  Translated by Jack Dawson.
